item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Bill Bryson
item.description: "Before, prior to. There is no difference between these two except length and a certain affectedness on the part of 'prior to.' To paraphrase Bernstein, if you would use 'posterior to' instead of 'after,' then by all means use 'prior to' instead of 'before." -- Bill Bryson

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Gerard Jones
item.description: "American men had made do for so long with smiling chorines and sweet titillation in their sleazy magazine that no one realised how hungry they were to have their sex mixed with terror and blood." -- Gerard Jones

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Kurt Vonnegut
item.description: "All persons, living and dead, are purely coincidental." -- Kurt Vonnegut

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Jamie S. Rich
item.description: "I was a happy melancholy, though â€” a contradiction in terms, to be sure, but every human understands this paradox, because they have all felt it." -- Jamie S. Rich

item.title: Jennifer add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "When I was a child, adults would tell me not to make things up, warning me of what would happen if I did. As far as I can tell so far, it seems to involve lots of foreign travel and not having to get up too early in the morning." -- Neil Gaiman
